embed.title: Hello!
embed.description:
Thank you for registering 
Please set a location `{{prefix}}location *street address + zip*` or add areas `{{prefix}}area add *name of area*` where to receive alarms from

fields.name: Welcome to Rotom!
fields.value: Rotom is an incredibly valuable tool that will transform the way you play the game. It has a learning curve, but with a little time and patience, it will quickly become your best friend. Maps are great and Rotom needs them to run, but instead of constantly checking the map for hundos or rare spawns, wouldn't you rather just receive personalized DM notifications about them? This welcome message will guide you through the very basics of setting up Rotom, but you will need to consult the #rotom-faq channel to get the full list of commands available.

fields.name: Two Types of Tracking:
fields.value: Rotom can be used in 1 of 2 ways. It can track by certain areas or by setting a specific location and tracking by specific distances from that point. Areas are easier to setup, but tracking by distance is much more customizable.

fields.name: Tracking by Areas:
fields.value:
Rotom has pre-determined areas (listed in #rotom-faq or by typing `{{prefix}}area list`) that you assign to yourself using the `{{prefix}}area add [area name]` command. Once you have your areas assigned, you track the Pokemon you want to receive alerts for with the various filters (level, IV, etc.) such as `{{prefix}}track everything iv100` - you will only receive alerts for these Pokemon if they are within the areas that you have signed up for. 
Quick Steps: 
1. `{{prefix}}area add Antarctica` 
2.`{{prefix}}track dratini iv100` 
This will result in you receieving alerts for all 100% Dratini in the Antarctica area! (Not really, check which areas we cover with `{{prefix}}area list`. 

__Benefits:__ 
-easy preset configuration covers entire area 
-don't have to set individual distance on every tracked spawn

fields.name: Tracking by a Specific Location & Distance:
fields.value:
You set your location using coordinates or a full address (must be found on Google Maps) by typing `{{prefix}}location *street address + zip code here*` This location can be manually changed, but does not automatically move when you do. 
Once your location is set, you track the Pokemon you want to receive alerts for within a specific distance (in meters) of that location. For example, you could `{{prefix}}track axew d30000` to be alerted of any Axew that spawns within 30,000meters (~20 miles) of you, and `{{prefix}}track everything iv100 d15000` to be alerted of any perfect spawn within 15,000m (~10 miles) of you. 
Quick Steps: 
1. `{{prefix}}location 420 S Orange Ave 02468` 
2. `{{prefix}}track everything iv100 d500` 
3. `{{prefix}}track axew deino litwick d5000` 
This will result in you receiving alerts for all hundos within 500m of your specified address and alerts of any Axew, Deino, or Litwick within 5000m.

__Benefits:__ 
-customizable by spawn 
-easily able to update location

fields.name: General Commands:
fields.value:
`{{prefix}}stop`: Temporarily stops DM Alerts 
`{{prefix}}start`: Re-enables DM Alerts 
`{{prefix}}track`: Used for Pokemon tracking, ie. `{{prefix}}track Pikachu iv90` will send you alerts for Pikachus with 90% IVs or higher. It is not necessary to put iv90-100. If you want a ceiling, use `$track Pikachu iv90 maxiv95`

**It is important to put *iv* before the number, otherwise it will not register. Ex: iv100 not 100iv**.

`{{prefix}}egg`: Will alert you about all raid eggs that will hatch soon. 
`{{prefix}}raid`: Used to track raids, ie. `{{prefix}}raid Kyogre` will alert you of all Kyogre raids. 
`{{prefix}}quest`: Will alert you of all specified quests at the time of detection, you will not receive the alerts if the quests have already been populated on the map. 
`{{prefix}}invasion`: Will alert you to all Team Rocket invasions at Pokestops in your area or specified distance. This is a Rotom++ feature only.

fields.name: Additional Information:
fields.value:
To view a full list of the available commands while using Rotom or Rotom++, please refer to #rotom-faq or ask us questions in #rotom-support! 
`{{prefix}}help`: Displays this message again!
